section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 12. Chapter 12: Diseases of the Skin and Subcutaneous Tissue > a. Pressure ulcer stage codes > 2) Unstageable pressure ulcers

content.full_text: Assignment of the code for unstageable pressure ulcer (L89.--0) should be based on the clinical documentation. These codes are used for pressure ulcers whose stage cannot be clinically determined (e.g., the ulcer is covered by eschar or has been treated with a skin or muscle graft). This code should not be confused with the codes for unspecified stage (L89.--9). When there is no documentation regarding the stage of the pressure ulcer, assign the appropriate code for unspecified stage (L89.--9). If during an encounter, the stage of an unstageable pressure ulcer is revealed after debridement, assign only the code for the stage revealed following debridement. (Evidence: pg no: 59, L36-L41)
content.summary: Guidelines for distinguishing between unstageable and unspecified stage pressure ulcers, including coding after debridement (Evidence: pg no: 59, L36-L41)
key_concepts: Unstageable vs unspecified stage distinction (Evidence: pg no: 59, L38-L39)
Clinical determination criteria (Evidence: pg no: 59, L36-L37)
Eschar and graft coverage examples (Evidence: pg no: 59, L37-L38)
Post-debridement coding rules (Evidence: pg no: 59, L41)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Unstageable codes (L89.--0) are for ulcers whose stage cannot be clinically determined (Evidence: pg no: 59, L36-L37)
detailed_rules.explanation: Use unstageable codes when clinical assessment of stage is impossible due to physical barriers like eschar or grafts (Evidence: pg no: 59, L37-L38)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Unspecified stage (L89.--9) is used when there is no documentation of stage, not when stage cannot be determined (Evidence: pg no: 59, L38-L39)
detailed_rules.explanation: Distinguish between lack of documentation (unspecified) and clinical inability to determine stage (unstageable) (Evidence: pg no: 59, L38-L39)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If stage is revealed after debridement during encounter, assign only the revealed stage code (Evidence: pg no: 59, L41)
detailed_rules.explanation: When debridement reveals the true stage during the same encounter, code only the revealed stage, not the unstageable code (Evidence: pg no: 59, L41)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Assess if stage can be clinically determined
Step 2: If cannot be determined due to eschar/graft, use L89.--0
Step 3: If no documentation of stage, use L89.--9
Step 4: If debridement reveals stage during encounter, use revealed stage code only

specific_codes.context: When stage cannot be clinically determined

specific_codes.description: Unspecified stage pressure ulcer codes (Evidence: pg no: 59, L38-L39)
specific_codes.context: When there is no documentation of stage

Step 3: Determine stage cannot be clinically assessed

correct_coding.rationale: Eschar prevents clinical stage determination, making ulcer unstageable (Evidence: pg no: 59, L37-L38)

incorrect_coding.rationale: This is unstageable due to eschar, not unspecified due to lack of documentation

coding_scenarios.scenario: Unstageable ulcer becomes stage 3 after debridement during same encounter
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Sacral pressure ulcer initially unstageable due to eschar. After debridement, revealed to be stage 3.
step_by_step: Step 2: Identify debridement procedure during encounter
Step 3: Note stage 3 revealed after debridement
Step 4: Assign only stage 3 code, not unstageable

correct_coding.rationale: When stage is revealed during encounter, code only the revealed stage (Evidence: pg no: 59, L41)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not code both unstageable and revealed stage
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding both unstageable and revealed stage

procedure_links.context: May reveal true stage of unstageable ulcers
procedure_links.note: Consider impact on pressure ulcer coding

examples.scenario: Different reasons for unstageable vs unspecified

breakdown.L89.--0: Eschar covered, graft covered - cannot assess clinically (Evidence: pg no: 59, L37-L38)
breakdown.L89.--9: No documentation of stage in medical record (Evidence: pg no: 59, L38-L39)

examples.rationale: Clear distinction between clinical inability to assess vs documentation gaps (Evidence: pg no: 59, L36-L39)

warnings: Do not confuse unstageable (L89.--0) with unspecified stage (L89.--9) (Evidence: pg no: 59, L38)
When stage revealed after debridement, assign only revealed stage code (Evidence: pg no: 59, L41)
best_practices: Base unstageable assignment on clinical documentation (Evidence: pg no: 59, L36)
Verify reason for inability to stage
Check for debridement procedures that may reveal stage
common_mistakes: Using unstageable when documentation is simply missing
Coding both unstageable and revealed stage after debridement
tips: Look for specific barriers to staging (eschar, grafts)
Review procedure notes for debridement findings
implementation_notes: Requires clear clinical documentation of staging barriers
May need provider clarification on staging ability
clinical_context: Eschar formation common in severe ulcers
Grafts may obscure original ulcer characteristics
